1) It'll serve no good for an elected American government to aggressively address the welfare of the Chinese people who may or may not want a regime change without harvesting significant geopolitical and economic gains in such a move.

2) I don't think I'll live to see Chinese totalitarianism collapse because the party-state, in tune with culture and tradition, has shown incredible resilience in situations where similarly repressive systems would've fallen multiple times.
